heisig_chinese_memo: Some restaurants have a small bell of gold to call someone to take customers' orders.
heisig_constituent: small bell, metal, gold, orders, meeting, chop-seal, hanko
koohiiStory1: Some restaurants have a small gold bell to call someone to take customers´ orders.
koohiiStory2: In high society, people ring a small golden bell to call their servants and give their orders.
jp_readingExamples: 電鈴 (でんれい), 振鈴 (しんすず), 予鈴 (よれい), 鈴 (すず)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You take gold in exchange for executing orders to construct a buzzer. You are a small bell maker and someone orders you to make one into a buzzer exchange for some gold. This is how you make a living.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the gold, heavy in your pockets, as you construct this buzzer with your bare hands. Feel the cool metal clink around in your hands as you put it together.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Finally the buzzer is done. You’ve earned your gold. You test the buzzer and it goes ring (りん)! Ring! Ring! Ring! Ring ring ring ring ring! Man, that ringing is annoying but hey, that’s what buzzers do.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Wait, should this buzzer be buzzing or ringing? Oh well, you got your gold. It’s the client’s problem now.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), 卩 (печать), 金 (золото)
Ru_trainchinese: líng: (сущ) колокол, звонок; предмет в форме колокола
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you're ordered (令) to use gold (金) for the small bell
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The golden small bell at a restaurant is used when you want to place your food orders.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " Gold " to " Ling ", " Ling " is sound symbol. " Bell " is a kind of sound device that can vibrate. Early Bronze " bell " for the word only " make " (as seen in weeks bell), " bell " is " to make newcomer word" of. "Zhou Li. Chunguan. Towel Car": "Making sacrifices, ring the bell to respond."

Bronze is the name of a musical instrument, namely bell. The king of Chu leads the bell: "The king of Chu leads the bell from Zha (made)." Bell and bell are used synonymously. It also means Luan Bell, which is attached to the top of the flag, and Mao Gongding: "Zhu Qi Er Ling." Also used as a person's name.

"Said Wen": "Ling, Ling Ding Ye. Cong Jin Cong Ling, Ling Yi Sheng."
humanum_full_description:
金文從「金」從「令」，「令」是聲符。「鈴」是一種可振動發聲的響器。早期金文「鈴」字只作「令」(見於成周鈴)，「鈴」是「令」的後起字。《周禮．春官．巾車》：「大祭祀，鳴鈴以應。」

　　金文是樂器名，即鐘，楚王領鐘：「楚王領自乍(作)鈴鐘」，鈴、鐘同義連用。又表示鸞鈴，綴於旗的頂端，毛公鼎：「朱旂二鈴。」又用作人名。

　　《說文》：「鈴，令丁也。从金从令，令亦聲。」

鈴(すず): bell

金文從「 金 」從「 令 」，「 令 」是聲符。「 鈴 」是一種可振動發聲的響器。早期金文「 鈴 」字只作「 令 」(見於成周鈴)，「 鈴 」是「 令 」的後起字。《周禮．春官．巾車》：「大祭祀，鳴鈴以應。」 金文是樂器名，即鐘，楚王領鐘：「楚王領自乍(作)鈴鐘」，鈴、鐘同義連用。又表示鸞鈴，綴於旗的頂端，毛公鼎：「朱旂二鈴。」又用作人名。 《說文》：「鈴，令丁也。从金从令，令亦聲。」
Bronze inscription from " Gold" to " Ling", " Ling" is sound symbol. " Bell" is a kind of sound device that can vibrate. Early Bronze " bell" for the word only " make" (as seen in weeks bell), " bell" is " to make newcomer word" of. "Zhou Li. Chunguan. Towel Car": "Making sacrifices, ring the bell to respond." Bronze is the name of a musical instrument, namely bell. The king of Chu leads the bell: "The king of Chu leads the bell from Zha (made)." Bell and bell are used synonymously. It also means Luan Bell, which is attached to the top of the flag, and Mao Gongding: "Zhu Qi Er Ling." Also used as a person's name. "Said Wen": "Ling, Ling Ding Ye. Cong Jin Cong Ling, Ling Yi Sheng."

鈴字的基本解释

鈴
líng
见“铃”。

鈴字的汉语字典释义

[①]［líng］
［《廣韻》郎丁切，平青，來。］
“铃1”的繁体字。
(1)以铜铁为圆壳，下面微裂，置金属丸于内，摇则发声。大小不一。多悬于车衡上、马颈下或旗杆顶。也有作为服饰的。
(2)形体似钟而小。有三种：（1）中悬铁制的铃胆，在钟体上置柄，或在铃心下系绳摇动发声，作发号司令之用。《周礼·春官·巾车》：“大祭祀，鳴鈴以應雞人。”郑玄注：“雞人主呼旦，鳴鈴以和之，聲且警衆。”《尉缭子·勒卒令》：“金、鼓、鈴、旗四者各有法……鈴，傳令也。”又如：上课铃响了，快进教室吧！（2）中悬金属片，多悬于宫殿楼阁等处的檐角，风动发声，作装点环境制造气氛之用。《晋书·艺术传·佛图澄》：“天静無風，而塔上一鈴獨鳴。”《宋史·礼志四》：“明堂庭樹松梓檜，門不設戟，殿角皆垂鈴。”（3）打击乐器。无舌，用单签敲击或两铃碰击发声。
(3)铃状物。
(4)比喻小声。
(5)即铃下。指侍卫、门卒或仆役。
(6)古代表示旌旗数的量词。

鈴字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鈴； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1299第28
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?郞丁切，音靈。【說文】令丁也。【廣韻】似鍾而小。【正韻】爲圜形，半裂以出聲，錮銅珠於內以鳴之。【左傳·桓二年】錫鸞和鈴，昭其聲也。【註】鈴在旂，有鳴聲。【釋文】鈴，音零。【爾雅·釋天】旌旂有鈴曰旂。　又【唐制】學士院深嚴，懸鈴索備警，長慶中河北用兵，常夜作聲以鳴緩急。【李德裕詩】銀花懸院榜，風撼引神鈴。　又【博雅】鈴鈴，聲也。【前漢·天文志】丙戌，地大動鈴鈴然。　又書名。【抱朴子·對俗卷】按玉鈴經中篇。　又【揚子·方言】好說而不見諸仲尼說鈴也。【註】喩小說不合大雅也。　又馬兜鈴，藥名。【本草】一名土靑木香。蔓生，葉脫時，其實尚?，如馬項鈴，故名。　又草名。【正字通】鈴兒草，卽沙薓，象花形。【墨莊漫錄】明宣德年，帝夢神語，雨打無聲鼓子花，帝口占，風吹不響鈴兒草，至今傳爲絕對。　又花名。【夢華錄】菊黃色而圓曰金鈴。　又與軨通。【周禮·春官·巾車】大祭祀，鳴鈴以應雞人。【註】鈴或作軨。　又【說文】霆雷餘聲也。鈴鈴所以挺出萬物

鈴字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鈴字的起名意思

暂无。

bell
Basic explanation of words
bell
líng
See "bell".
bell
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［líng］
["Guangyun" Lang Dingqie, Pingqing, come. ]
The traditional characters of "铃1".
(1) Use copper and iron as the round shell, the bottom is slightly cracked, and the metal pellets are placed inside. Shake it to make a sound. Different sizes. It is mostly hung on the weighing scale, under the neck of the horse, or on the top of the flagpole. There are also costumes.
(2) The shape is like a bell but small. There are three types: (1) A bell with a centrally suspended iron bell, with a handle on the bell body, or a tether under the bell's heart to make a sound, as a commander. "Zhou Li · Chun Guan · Towel Car": "Making sacrifices, ring the bell to respond to the rooster man." Zheng Xuan's note: "The rooster master calls the Dan, ring the bell to harmonize, the sound and the police." "Wei Liaozi· "Lesson Order": "Gold, drums, bells, and flags have their own methods...bells, so do the orders." Another example: the class bell rang, go into the classroom! (2) The middle-hung metal pieces are mostly hung on the eaves of palaces, pavilions, etc., where the wind makes noise, which is used to decorate the environment and create atmosphere. "Book of Jin·Art Biography·Buddha Tucheng": "The sky is quiet and there is no wind, but a bell on the tower sings alone." "Song History·The Fourth Book of Rites": "Ming Tang court tree pine and cypress, no halberd on the door, all corners of the temple Bell." (3) Percussion. No tongue, use single-sign tapping or two-bell tapping to make a sound.
(3) Bells.
(4) The analogy is quiet.
(5) Under the bell. Refers to guards, doormen, or servants.
(6) The quantifier used to express the number of banners in ancient times.
bell
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Bell; Kangxi strokes: 13; Page number: page 1299 28
【Tang Yun】【Ji Yun】【Rhyme Meeting】? Yin Dingqie, the sound is good. [Said the text] Ling Ding also. [Guang Yun] Like a clock but small. [Positive rhyme] It is a round shape, half-cracked to make a sound, and a copper bead inside to sing. [Zuo Zhuan·Huan Ernian] Xiluan and Ling, the sound is also clear. [Note] The bell is on the flag and there is a ringing sound. 【Explanation】Ring, the tone is zero. 【Erya·Shitian】The flag is called the flag with bells.　[Tang Dynasty] The Academy of Academy is deep and strict, hanging bells for police, Changqing Central Hebei uses soldiers, and always makes noise at night to keep anxious. [Poems by Li Deyu] Yinhua hangs on the hospital list, and the wind shakes the bells.　[Bo Ya] Ringing, the sound is also. [Previous Han·Astronomy] Bingxu, the earth is moving and the bells are ringing.　Also the title of the book. [Baopuzi·Daisu Juan] Press the second chapter of the Jade Bell Sutra.　[Yangtze Dialect] It’s easy to talk without seeing Zhu Zhongni. [Note] Wu's novels are not elegant either.　Aristolochia, the name of the medicine. [Materia Medica] A soil scented wood. When sprawling, when the leaves are off, it is actually still?, like Ma Xiangling, hence the name.　Also cursive name. 【Zhengzitong】Lingergrass, saffron, flower-like shape. [Mo Zhuang Man Record] In the Ming Dynasty Xuande year, the divine dream, the rain beats the silent drum flower, the emperor's mouth is occupied, the wind does not ring the bell grass, and it is still said to be absolute.　Also known as the flower name. [Meng Hua Lu] The yellow chrysanthemum and the circle are called golden bells.　 and Tong Tong again. 【Zhou Ceremony·Chunguan·Towel Car】Major sacrifice, ring the bell to respond to the rooster. 【Note】Ling or making 軨.　[Said the text] Tinglei's voice. So Lingling stands out

Name meaning

líng
вм. 铃
Radicals: 金, 令  (gold, orders)
Meaning Mnemonic
You take gold in exchange for executing orders to construct a buzzer. You are a small bell maker and someone orders you to make one into a buzzer exchange for some gold. This is how you make a living.
Imagine the gold, heavy in your pockets, as you construct this buzzer with your bare hands. Feel the cool metal clink around in your hands as you put it together.
Reading Mnemonic
Finally the buzzer is done. You’ve earned your gold. You test the buzzer and it goes ring (りん)! Ring! Ring! Ring! Ring ring ring ring ring! Man, that ringing is annoying but hey, that’s what buzzers do.
Wait, should this buzzer be buzzing or ringing? Oh well, you got your gold. It’s the client’s problem now.
